edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.interpreter

Interface ICorrelateSource

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CorrelateSource

    public interface ICorrelateSource
    ICorrelateSource correlates a span in transformed code, given by beginning and ending line and column number, to an approximate span in the original source code.
    CorrelateSource is intended to be used with interpreter modules that decorate a parsed AST with source location attributes before transformation, carry this information through the transformation chains, then use these approximation techniques after transformation to back-correlate error locations for debugging.

    • Method Detail

      • decoratePosition

        Document decoratePosition(Document parseTree)
        Decorates parseTree adding line and column attributes to the concrete syntax nodes. Concrete syntax node types are defined in docs/schemas/SourceAST.xsd. Line index origin is 0, and Column index origin is 0.

      • isConcreteSyntax

        boolean isConcreteSyntax(Node node)
        Checks if node is concrete syntax node. Concrete syntax is carried by Element nodes with "@ID" attribute or text child node.

      • getTextValue

        String getTextValue(Node node)
        Gets text value for concrete syntax node.
        Returns:
        value of DELIMITER ID attribute, or first text node child, or null otherwise.

      • getDecoratedLine

        int getDecoratedLine(Node node)
        Gets line number for given decorated node.
        Returns:
        line, or -1 if not numeric or "line" attribute not found.

      • getDecoratedColumn

        int getDecoratedColumn(Node node)
        Gets beginning column number for given decorated node.
        Returns:
        column, or -1 if not numeric or "column" attribute not found.

      • findDecoratedSpan

        int[] findDecoratedSpan(Document parseTree,
                        int fromLine,
                        int fromColumn,
                        int toLine,
                        int toColumn)
        Finds closest bounding decorated concrete syntax nodes in AST for given span in source. Source can be subset of ParseTree, e.g., for Groovy we preserve ";" in Deconstructed.xsl but it is removed from source. So ignores a parse token if it is not found as next token in source, i.e., is found but separated by non-whitespace. Line index origin is 0, and Column index origin is 0. fromLine < 0 is first line; fromColumn < 0 is first column. toLine < 0 is last line; toColumn < 0 is end of toLine.
        Returns:
        [fromLine, fromColumn, toLine, toColumn]

      • extractDecoratedLines

        String extractDecoratedLines(int fromLine,
                             int fromColumn,
                             int toLine,
                             int toColumn)
        Extracts lines from source for the span defined by the line and column numbers in the closest bounding decorated nodes. Decorates extracted lines with "^" symbols for span start and end. Line index origin is 0, and Column index origin is 0. fromLine < 0 is first line; fromColumn < 0 is first column. toLine < 0 is last line; toColumn < 0 is end of toLine.

      • getSourceLine

        String getSourceLine(int line)
        Extracts line with corresponding line number from source. Line index origin is 0.
        Returns:
        Last line if line > number of lines in source, or entire source if line < 0, or empty string if source was null.

      • getNumLines

        int getNumLines()
        Gets number of lines in source.

      • getDefaultSourceLineSeparator

        String getDefaultSourceLineSeparator()
        Gets default source line separator.

        void setDefaultSourceLineSeparator(String linesep)
        Sets default source line separator.

        String getDefaultExtractLineSeparator()
        Gets default line separator for decorated extracts.

        void setDefaultExtractLineSeparator(String linesep)
        Sets default line separator for decorated extracts.

      • getSourceLineSeparator

        String getSourceLineSeparator()
        Gets source line separator.

      • setSourceLineSeparator

        void setSourceLineSeparator(String linesep)
        Sets source line separator.

      • getExtractLineSeparator

        String getExtractLineSeparator()
        Gets line separator for decorated extracts using extractDecoratedLines.

      • setExtractLineSeparator

        void setExtractLineSeparator(String linesep)
        Sets line separator for decorated extracts using extractDecoratedLines.

      • getConcreteSyntaxNodes

        String[] getConcreteSyntaxNodes()
        Gets XML concrete syntax node names used in correlating source.
